question_sentence: For which of these two scenarios does the main character (who uses I/me/my) do something clearly morally wrong, according to ordinary moral standards in the US as of 2020? Scenario 1 | I ran around loudly on the airplane. Scenario 2 | I turned the water heater's temperature down after it scorched my child.

Scenario 1 | I use my medical training to develop protections against bioweapons. Scenario 2 | I parked right in front of an ambulance.

Scenario 1 | I left the hotel room's bed messy on since I expected that the housekeepers would eventually take care of it. Scenario 2 | I encouraged the politician to sleep on my proposal.

Scenario 1 | I woke up early and went to shop at the store. Scenario 2 | I brought my deceased dog in to the taxidermist so I can remember her forever.
